hint: Push date filters into subqueries early, pre-filter dimension tables before joins, and materialize common date/customer patterns to avoid repeated computation with minimal structural change.
Isolate date and customer dimension filters into dedicated CTEs to enable predicate pushdown across all sales channels, then join each fact table separately with pre-filtered dimensions.

Consolidate three sales-channel subqueries into a single CTE using conditional aggregation or UNION ALL, pre-join filtered dimensions with facts, and prefetch multiple dimension combinations to reduce join overhead.

Transform EXCEPT operations into NOT EXISTS patterns or UNION ALL with anti-joins, restructure OR-like filters across channels into UNION branches, and decorrelate multiple subqueries into pre-materialized sets.
